title: Meaning of Suhoor and Iftaar - Dr Zakir Naik
transcript: I'd like to start the topic with an essential one even myself I'm not 100% sure of the implications of the terms and could you shed some light on these uh terms for us alhamdulillah the word it is derived from the Arabic word which means the later part of the night and its plural is called as ashar and Arabic word sahur means a meal which is taken just before the break of dawn and the Arabic word is the act of taking the meal sahur so is the act and suur is the pre-dawn meal as far as the Arabic word ifar is concerned the word ifar is derived from the Arabic word f which means to tear or which means to break and the word fatur means the meal taken to break the Fast and the Arabic word ifar means the act of taking the meal to break the fast
